Turing Award 2014

Winner: Michael Stonebreaker

In 2014 Michael Stonebreaker received the Turing Award. His contribution regarding databases helped him to receive the award. By his research activities at the University of Berkeley he laid the foundation for receiving the award. Ingres and Postgres had a significant contribution to the award winning decision. Big data storage was revolutionised by Stonebreakers databases by optimising collection, organisation and access of data.
